text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!
And Happy Holidays!

In honor of the holidays we are gonna be making
something Ginger Bread.

Last year we made a Gingerbread Tardis, I’ll
put a link somewhere to that so you

can go check it out, and this year I’m gonna
be making something ginger bread again

because it’s the perfect thing to do for
the holidays.

We are gonna be making Ninja Bread Men! I
saw this idea online, I got all these cutes
little ninja cookie cutters, dee-dee-dee-dee-dee!
These are so cool!

I’ll put a link down below so that if you’re
interested in getting these you

can do that. And, if not, if you just have
a regular gingerbread cookie cutter,

that’s fine, because you can ice him to
look like a little ninja.
Alright, let’s get started!

I am gonna be making the pre-made gingerbread
cookies because it saves a lot of

time and it’s super yummy! But if you have
a favorite gingerbread recipe, use it!

OK, so we pour this in here, in a big mixing
bowl.
Ooooh-oooh-oooh-erwagh-erwagh-erwagh-erwagh-erwagh-erwagh-doo-doo-doo-doo-da-doo-doo!
Perfect, OK!

Then we add 1 egg, and 6 tablespoons of softened
butter, softened just means

I took it out of the refrigerator and I let
it get nice and room temperature.
Bloop-bloop-bloop!

Alright, now I’m just gonna take an electric
hand mixer, and mix everything together.
Bump-ba-da-bum-ba-da-bum-ba-ba-bum!

Alright, after you’ve mixed all your gingerbread
together, you’re gonna actually

use your hands, get in there until your dough
is like this, you can throw it around
in a ball, a-ha-ha!

And what you’re gonna do is take some flour,
sprinkle it down on the table,

so that your cookie dough doesn’t stick
to the table.
Pat it down flat.

Sprinkle a little flour on top, take your
rolling pin,
sprinkle a little flour on there.

And then roll it out. Oh this smells so good!
It smells like Christmas!
Doo-da-doo, doo-da-doo, do-da-dooooooo!

Once your dough is nice and flat, you’re
gonna take your little cookie cutters

and cut out as many gingerbread men as you
can!

I just press down, and jiggle, jiggle, jiggle,
jiggle!

Now that you got all your ninja bread men
on the cookie sheet, you’re gonna

heat your oven to 350 and you’re gonna bake
these for 7-9 minutes just depending

on your oven and what type of pan you’re
using.

So just keep your eyes on ‘dose sneaky Ninja
Bread Men!
Once your Gingerbread Men are all done baking, da-daaaa! You’re gonna let them cool for about

20 minutes on the cookie sheet, and then they’re
ready to decorate.
Look how cute they are, hwah-hwah-wha-whaw-hwah!

These little ninja cookie cutters came with
this, it’s a little decorating guide.

I’m gonna start out with… Ah, the red
ninja, cuz he’s like a christmas color!

Ta-da! Here are our Ninja Bread Men Cookies,
they’re so cute!

I just put 3 out here for you to look at,
I made a ton more, but I decorated

them red on red, white on white and black
on black, and then black little eyeballs!

They’re so cute, I wanted to make something
gingerbread and something super

easy for the holidays, I hope you guys liked
it!

If you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know,

leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen!

Also, you can follow me on Facebook and Twitter,
I’ll post lots of pictures,

and I love getting fan pictures of things
you guys have made, and I’ll post them
on Facebook and Twitter too!
Alright, thanks you guys Happy Holidays!
And, bye-bye!
Bye-bye!
